title: Trump Pulls Military Into Another Political Issue
summary: The National Guard troops who will move into Washington, D.C., will not perform law enforcement tasks but may be able to detain people temporarily, officials said.

title: Trump Takes Control of D.C. Police, Citing ‘Bloodthirsty Criminals.’ But Crime Is Down.
summary: The president has railed against crime in urban, largely liberal cities for decades, but Monday’s announcement was an extraordinary exertion of federal power over an American city.

title: Does President Trump Want to Be Mayor, Too?
summary: President Trump has long railed about crime in blue cities. Now he’s effectively put himself in charge of policing one of them.

title: Trump Names EJ Antoni New BLS Commissioner
summary: President Trump fired the Bureau of Labor Statistics chief earlier this month after a downbeat jobs report. The move has raised concerns about the credibility of economic data going forward.

title: Harvard Nears a Deal With the Trump Administration to Restore Funding
summary: A potential $500 million settlement would end a monthslong battle that pitted the nation’s wealthiest school against the Trump administration’s extraordinary crackdown on higher education.

title: Trump Extends China Tariff Truce by Three Months
summary: President Trump’s order continues a reprieve from the threat of escalating tariffs and export controls, which rocked the global economy earlier this year.

title: Brazil Clamped Down on Big Tech. Trump’s Tariffs Could Change That.
summary: With President Trump on their side, U.S. technology companies now have more leverage in Brazil, where they seek to influence new rules policing their platforms.

title: Trump Says He’s Going to Alaska to See What Putin ‘Has in Mind’
summary: President Trump set a low bar for his summit with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, saying he was ready to walk away if no deal was forthcoming.

title: Foreign Recruits in Ukraine Military Are Killed in Russian Missile Strike
summary: Russia has repeatedly targeted soldiers assembled at military academies, barracks and parade grounds.

title: 3 Dead, 1 Injured After Target Shooting in Austin, Texas
summary: The gunman fled and was caught after stealing two cars, the police said.

title: Are Samosas Unhealthy? Some Indians Find Official Advice Hard to Swallow.
summary: A government advisory noting the high fat and sugar levels in many popular snacks was seen by some as an attack on India’s beloved street food.

title: Who Were the Al Jazeera Journalists Killed in an Israeli Strike in Gaza?
summary: Officials accused Anas al-Sharif of being a Hamas operative posing as a reporter. Al Jazeera says he and the other four victims all worked for the network.

title: What to Know About Al Jazeera, the Broadcaster Israel Accuses of Supporting Hamas
summary: Al Jazeera, five of whose reporters the broadcaster said were killed by an Israeli strike, has angered governments across the region that claim it gives voice to terrorists. The outlet denies that.

title: How Rick Perry Became a Fervent Advocate for the Psychedelic Ibogaine
summary: The former Texas governor and Trump energy secretary has now dedicated his life to promoting the powerful psychedelic ibogaine.

title: Judge Will Not Unseal Grand Jury Papers of Maxwell, Epstein’s Companion
summary: President Trump has tried to subdue conspiracy theories by pushing to disclose the transcripts from the cases of Jeffrey Epstein, who abused teenage girls, and Ghislaine Maxwell, who assisted him.

title: Sheila Jordan, Fearless Vocal Improviser, Is Dead at 96
summary: She was revered in the jazz world as a chance taker who communicated an effervescent joy in the pure act of singing.

title: The Reasons Israelis Have Closed Their Eyes to Gaza
summary: Multiple factors have caused the starvation ravaging Gaza. But Israel must accept that its actions are the main cause.

title: A Right-Wing Influencer Tried to Be a Tradwife. It Almost Broke Her.
summary: Being an anti-feminist, it turns out, is no shield against abusive male power.

title: 2 Killed in Explosion at U.S. Steel Plant in Pennsylvania
summary: Ten people were hospitalized after the blast at a coke plant in Clairton, Pa., near Pittsburgh. One person who had been missing was found dead late on Monday.

title: The Fake Heiress, the Instagram Shoot and the Abandoned Bunnies
summary: Three rabbits used in a photo shoot featuring Anna Delvey, whose real name is Anna Sorokin, were found abandoned in Prospect Park in Brooklyn.

title: Christophe de Menil, Art Patron and Designer, Is Dead at 92
summary: A Parisian-born oil heiress, she collected art and supported major artists, designed costumes and moved in rarefied social and cultural circles.
